ngiemboon: Á táa ńgwɔ́ na mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ legém, á na mbɔ́ɔntè saŋ legém, á na mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ lepfwɔʼɔ́, Nambukondonozɔɔ fùɔ pà Mbambilonia lɔg palÿɔ́ʼncù pé ntsèm ńgʉa lélÿɔ́ʼɔ Yelúzálèm lé ncù. Ńkúu wó, ńkwɛ́ɛ lepumó sɔ́b á ncú tÿǒsoŋ, ńtúŋo sém ńdɔg ḿbú ńkéle tÿǒsoŋ.
en: In the ninth year   of Zedekiah’s reign,  # 25:1–7 Jr 39:1–7; 52:4–11 on the tenth day of the tenth month, King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon advanced against Jerusalem with his entire army.  # 25:1 Jr 21:2; 34:1–2; Ezk 24:2 They laid siege to the city and built a siege wall against it all around.  # 25:1 Ezk 21:22

ngiemboon: Palÿɔ́ʼncù fùɔ Nambukondonozɔɔ la láʼ ńtíʼi tÿǒsoŋ tǐʼ tà ńkúu na mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b wémɔʼɔ́ né legém we lefùɔ se Sendesíasè.
en: The city was under siege until King Zedekiah’s eleventh year.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ na mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌ʼ lepfwɔʼɔ́ na saŋ lekùɔ, gẅie gwáŋa la pú ńgwe tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ, tà tsɔ́ mmó mpfɛ̌ té gíŋe ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́,
en: By the ninth day of the fourth month the famine was so severe in the city that the common people had no food.

ngiemboon: epʉ̀a Mbambilonia tɔ́g lepÿé na tʉ̂ankáʼ gẅie à tiʼi tÿǒsoŋ. Ńgwaa tɔ́g púʼu, mbà palÿɔ́ʼncù pʉ̀a Yúndà ně ńdáʼa láʼ, éshúu na mesẅɛ̌ɛ mie ée ngʉ̀ŋe nkáʼa nzab mentí mentí we fùɔ, ńkÿo, mbɔɔ páʼ á la gwaa gwɔ́ mbà pʉ̀a Mbambilonia pú ńzéme Yelúzálèm. Afùɔ Sendesíasè kÿo ḿpfó ye mánzsè fúʼu Juundʉŋ.
en: Then the city was broken into,   and all the warriors fled  # 25:4 Ezk 33:21 at night by way of the city gate between the two walls near the king’s garden,  # 25:4 Neh 3:15 even though the Chaldeans surrounded the city. As the king made his way along the route to the Arabah,  # 25:4 Dt 2:8

ngiemboon: Táʼ, palÿɔ́ʼncù pe pʉ̀a Mbambilonia cʉ́me nzèm yé, ńjwoŋo yé tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kwòŋo témmó gie áa Yelíkò, ńgwoon yé. Palÿɔ́ʼncù pé gwáʼa yé ńkÿo.
en: the Chaldean army pursued him and overtook him in the plains of Jericho. Zedekiah’s entire army left him and scattered.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Mbambilonia lɔgɔ fùɔ ńgʉa né mvfò fùɔ wɔb, á Limbela, ńŋaga yé ńzáʼ tsaŋ ye.
en: The Chaldeans seized the king   and brought him up to the king of Babylon  # 25:6 Jr 32:4 at Riblah,  # 25:6 Nm 34:11; 2Kg 23:33; Jr 52:9 and they passed sentence on him.

ngiemboon: Ńzẅéte penkʉ́ pé pembàŋa menÿɔ́g yé, ḿbyág menÿɔ́g Sendesíasè, ńdɔg menkÿo tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńkwɛ́ɛ yé, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa né Mbambilonia.
en: They slaughtered Zedekiah’s sons before his eyes. Finally, the king of Babylon blinded Zedekiah, bound him in bronze chains, and took him to Babylon.

ngiemboon: Á laa na mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔʼɔ́ né legém, á na lyɛ̌ʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a na saŋ tʉ̂a, léfó páʼ fùɔ Nambukondonozɔɔ la néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ, Nembuzalandaŋ gẅie à laa tándá nùɔ papyɛ́bɛ fùɔ, gʉa Yelúzálèm.
en: On   the seventh day of the fifth month #— #which was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon #— #Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guards, a servant of the king of Babylon, entered Jerusalem.  # 25:8 2Kg 24:12; Jr 39:9; 52:12

ngiemboon: Ńkúu wó, ńtuɔ ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńtuɔ nɔʼ, ńtuɔ mendá Yelúzálèm ntsèm, ḿbú éshÿɔ́g mmɔ̌g na memǎa mendá ntsèm.
en: He burned the Lord’s temple,   the king’s palace,  # 25:9 Jr 39:8; Am 2:5 and all the houses of Jerusalem; he burned down  # 25:9 Jr 17:27 all the great houses.

ngiemboon: Anùɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù gie pâ tándá nùɔ papyɛ́bɛ fùɔ la gwɔ́, á la pú ńtág metʉ̂ankáʼ mie mé la kwɛ́, ńdɔg ńkéle tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm.
en: The whole Chaldean army with the captain of the guards tore down the walls   surrounding Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Nembuzalandaŋ gẅie à laa tándá palÿɔ́ʼncù gwoon pfwɔ̀ʼɔ pʉ̀a pie é la nyé tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgʉa né Mbambilonia, mbɔɔ pʉ̀a pie é la gʉa lé mvfò fùɔ Mbambilonia, ńgÿo pfwɔ̀ʼɔ láʼ ntsèm.
en: Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guards, deported the rest of the people who remained in the city, the deserters who had defected to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the population.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, tándá nùɔ papyɛ́bɛ fùɔ la gʉa na mepóŋ, ńnyé petsɔ́, páʼ pɔ́ ge gwaa ne gwɔ́ pajʉ́ʼngwóŋ, é gíŋ gwɔ́ pakyéen mentɔ̌ɔn metÿǒ melùʼ.
en: But the captain of the guards left some of the poorest of the land to be vinedressers and farmers.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Mbambilonia la pwɔ́ʼte mentóon mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte ńtÿɔ́gɔ ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, éshʉ́ate máa ngwʉ̌ŋ gẅie à laa ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńkaa tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńdɔg ńgʉa né Mbambilonia.
en: Now   the Chaldeans broke into pieces the bronze pillars  # 25:13 2Kg 20:17; 2Ch 36:18; Jr 52:17 of the Lord’s temple, the water carts, and the bronze basin,  # 25:13 Lit sea,# 25:13 1Kg 7:23; 2Ch 4:2–4 which were in the Lord’s temple, and carried the bronze to Babylon.  # 25:13 Jr 27:19–22

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la pú ńkaa shúm sie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte, ńdɔgɔ faʼa ndá Ssé: é metúŋ lɔg ńtúʼu pfó, é meshú, á lɔg ḿbyág mmɔ̌g na lâm, mbɔɔ menně.
en: They also took the pots, shovels, wick trimmers, dishes, and all the bronze articles used in the priests’ service.

ngiemboon: Tándá palÿɔ́ʼncù gíŋe ńkaa shúm ntsèm sie mé lɔgɔ tʉ̌ nkáb, mbɔɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte, é shúm páʼ lɔg ńtuɔ laméndɔ̀ɔn, ńgÿo se lɔg ńza metse.
en: The captain of the guards took away the firepans and sprinkling basins #— #whatever was gold or silver.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Salémo la gÿo mé lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte shúm ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn: mɔɔn laa mentóon mémbʉ́a, wɔɔn gwɔ́ máa ngwʉ̌ŋ, ńgÿo mefòŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a pie máa ngwʉ̌ŋ la tyé ndumó, ńgÿo mekélêg lÿóon. Atsɔ̌ léfʉʼ mɔɔn metʉ̌ mie mé la lɔg ńnyɛte sɔɔn shúm tà ńzsé nzẅìŋ, à la té wó wɔ́.
en: As for the two pillars, the one basin, and the water carts that Solomon had made for the Lord’s temple, the weight of the bronze of all these articles was beyond measure.

ngiemboon: Ewɛ̌ ntóon wɔ́ɔ la gẅiin fʉ̀ʼ mmó memítà lepfwɔʼɔ́, á na ntyě. Ńgʉa na ntsɔ̀ʼ wɛ̌ ntóon wɔ́ɔ, ntoŋ gẅie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnyɛte gwɔ́ mǒ, tà wé ntyě gwɔ́ tàʼ mítà lé tsěm. Embùm yɛ̌ gwɔ́ mbà mé la cʉ́ʼʉ lékẅiŋ ńdɔgɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńkaa jʉ́jʉ́ŋ tsɔ̌ ntí lekÿo pɔ́ jʉ́jʉ́ŋ ntɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ ŋwʉ́ŋe mǒ. Mé la pú ńkẅiŋ mentóon ŋwɛ́ mémbʉ́a pɔ́ tàʼa mmó.
en: One pillar was twenty-seven feet   tall and had a bronze capital on top of it. The capital, encircled by a grating and pomegranates of bronze, stood five feet  # 25:17 Lit three cubits high. The second pillar was the same, with its own grating.  # 25:17 1Kg 7:15–22

ngiemboon: Tándá nùɔ papyɛ́bɛ fùɔ la gwoon Selaya gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ welÿò, ńgwoon Sefaniya gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ, ńgwɔ́ nkẅèpwó we, ńgíŋ ńgwoon panuŋepwɔʼ metá pie é lɔ̌ɔn ḿbyɛ́bɛ ncwònkáʼ.
en: The captain of the guards   also took away Seraiah  # 25:18 1Ch 6:14; Ezr 7:1 the chief priest, Zephaniah  # 25:18 Jr 21:1; 29:25,29 the priest of the second rank, and the three doorkeepers.

ngiemboon: À la gÿo mé gwoon ngàŋafàʼ gẅie yé zɔ líe palÿɔ́ʼncù, ńgíŋ ńgÿo ńgwoon pʉ̀a métʉ̂a pie é la tswéʼe na fùɔ, mbà pɔ́ la zso tÿǒsoŋ. Ńgíŋ ńgÿo mé gwoon ntẅènzóŋ we palÿɔ́ʼncù gẅie yé zɔ lɔ̌ɔn ńnéŋe palÿɔ́ʼncù na fàʼ, ńgíŋ ńgÿo ńgwoon pʉ̀a Yúndà móm ntɔgɔ́ pie é laa tÿǒsoŋ.
en: From the city he took a court official   who had been appointed over the warriors; five trusted royal aides  # 25:19 Lit five men who look on the king’s face,# 25:19 Jr 52:25 found in the city; the secretary of the commander of the army, who enlisted the people of the land for military duty; and sixty men from the common people  # 25:19 Lit the people of the land who were found within the city.

ngiemboon: Nembuzalandaŋ gẅie aa tándá nùɔ papyɛ́bɛ fùɔ la lɔgɔ wɔb ńgʉa ńgyá fùɔ Mbambilonia á Limbela.
en: Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guards, took them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.

ngiemboon: Ńkúu Limbela gẅie aa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Amad, afùɔ Mbambilonia pú ńzẅéte wɔ́b.
en: The king of Babylon put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah went into exile from its land.

ngiemboon: Nambukondonozɔɔ fùɔ Mbambilonia la gʉa na pʉ̀a pie é la zso tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Yúndà, é pʉ̀a pie à la zẅíŋ ngie pɔ́ zso wó, ńtsɔ́ʼɔ Ngendalia gẅie aa míŋ Ayikam, ńgwɔ́ míŋ míŋ Shÿafaŋ, páʼ à sáʼa wɔ́b.
en: King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon appointed Gedaliah   son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, over the rest of the people he left in the land of Judah.  # 25:22 Is 1:9; Jr 40:5

ngiemboon: Metándá palÿɔ́ʼncù ntsèm pâ palÿɔ́ʼncù pʉ̀a Yúndà la gwɔ́ tà ńjúʼ ngie fùɔ Mbambilonia ka lɔgɔ Ngendalia ńgÿo fùɔ, ńgʉa né Misepa légyá yé. Mezíŋ metándá palÿɔ́ʼncù ŋwɛ́ é mɔɔn: wɔɔn laa Esemayɛ̂ɛ míŋ Netania, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Yohanaŋ míŋ Kaleya, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Selaya míŋ Tanehumed gẅie aa nyìŋ Netofa, ńgÿo Yazania míŋ Maaka, á wɔ́b pâ pʉ̀a pɔ́b.
en: When all the commanders of the armies #— #they and their men #— #heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah, they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah.   The commanders included Ishmael son of Nethaniah, Johanan son of Kareah, Seraiah son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah son of the Maacathite #— #they and their men.  # 25:23 Jr 40:7–8

ngiemboon: Ńkúu wó, Ngendalia gɔɔn né pɔ́b mbɔɔ né pʉ̀a pɔ́b tà ńkʉa ngie: «Pi pɔ́ɔn lépɔ́g pʉ̀a Mbambilonia. Pi néŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ, éfaʼa mbwó fùɔ Mbambilonia, à cʉa púʼu, pi júʼ mboŋó.»
en: Gedaliah swore an oath to them and their men, assuring them, “Don’t be afraid of the servants of the Chaldeans. Live in the land and serve the king of Babylon, and it will go well for you.”

ngiemboon: Táʼ, á gwaa gwɔ́ na mbɔ́ɔntè saŋ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, pɔ́ na yɛ̌ ngùʼ ŋwɛ́, Esemayɛ̂ɛ gẅie aa míŋ Netania, ńgwɔ́ míŋ míŋ Elishÿama gẅie à laa nyìŋ ńkẅɛɛ na tsìŋendá fùɔ pà Yúndá, á lɔg pʉ̀a legém ńtóo Misepa; pɔ́ zẅé Ngendalia, ńgíŋ ńzẅé pʉ̀a Yúndà, mbɔɔ pʉ̀a Mbambilonia pie pâ pɔ̌ laa Misepa.
en: In the seventh month, however, Ishmael son of Nethaniah, son of Elishama, of the royal family, came with ten men and struck down Gedaliah, and he died. Also, they killed the Judeans and the Chaldeans who were with him at Mizpah.

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu, epʉ̀a metsèm léfó na penkʉ́ ńgʉa ńkúu na melÿò, é gʉate né ngwòŋ Egíbtò, pâ metándá palÿɔ́ʼncù, mélàʼmie pɔ́ la ne ḿbɔ́gɔ pʉ̀a Mbambilonia.
en: Then all the people, from the youngest to the oldest, and the commanders of the army, left and went to Egypt, for they were afraid of the Chaldeans.

ngiemboon: Eví-Melondag la gwaa cʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ Mbambilonia, mbà é tɔ́g ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b sɔɔnmbʉ́a né móm tá páʼ mé la gwoon fùɔ Jÿohakiŋ ńdɔg fó tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Yúndà ńgʉa. É gwaa gwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ ntsɔ̀b sɔɔnmbʉ́a né móm mbʉ́a, á na sáŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ̀a na ngùʼ gie à cʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ, Eví-Melondag fùɔ pà Mbambilonia cÿó gʉ́me Jÿohakiŋ fùɔ pà Yúndà, éfó ndátsǎŋ ńkẅile yé.
en: On   the twenty-seventh day of the twelfth month of the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Judah’s King Jehoiachin, in the year Evil-merodach became king of Babylon, he pardoned King Jehoiachin  # 25:27 2Kg 24:12 of Judah and released him  # 25:27 and released him supplied for clarity from prison.  # 25:27 Gn 40:13,20

ngiemboon: Ńkẅile yé púʼu, ńdɔgɔ pòŋontʉ́m ńgɔɔn nò né yé, ḿbiŋ ńnéŋe yé na lʉŋe lefùɔ gie á cʉa ye petsɔ́ mefùɔ pie pâ pɔ̌ ée Mbambilonia.
en: He spoke kindly   to him and set his throne over the thrones of the kings who were with him in Babylon.  # 25:28 Ezr 5:5; 7:6,28

ngiemboon: Ńgÿo mé sẅɛ́ menzsǒ megàŋatsǎŋ na yé, pɔ́ yé zɔ cʉ́ʼʉ ńteme shúm ḿpfɛ́ɛ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm.
en: So Jehoiachin changed his prison clothes, and he dined regularly in the presence of the king of Babylon for the rest of his life.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Eví-Melondag zɔ lɔ̌ɔn ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńnáa shúm sie é ne ńzɛ́te mbwó Jÿohakiŋ lyɛ̌ʼ ntsèm tà á láʼ ńkwé.
en: As for his allowance, a regular allowance   was given to him by the king, a portion for each day, for the rest of his life.
